page.title: 02Education
page.content: The school was built in approximately 1903.Before that there was a school known as the 'Madras School'. It is now a ruin on the hillside.The school serves the whole parish of Stenness and only rarely takes pupils from outside the parish.At the moment it is the smallest school on the Mainland(the main island)of Orkney.41 pupils attend this school and there are two teachers and three visiting teachers.There are seven classes in the school with on average six pupils in each class.One of the teachers teaches classes1,2 and 3 and the other teacher,classes 4 to 7.Most children come to school by mini-bus or car.the school uses the local community centre for gym and music lessons.Most children take school dinners which are brought in from a school kitchen 3 miles away.
